page.title: 17GLOSSOPDALE A COTTON WORKER
page.content: {Mr. Nixon}is an old gentleman who lives in{Hadfield}and who has spent most of his working-life here in the {mills.}He moved here in{1929}when many Lancashire mills were closing owing to a slump in trade.{Mills}in this area were being equipped with more modern automatic looms . At first he worked at Waterside Mill as a weaver for 10 hours a day but over the years the hours were gradually reduced and conditions at work were improved. The hours were still long and the pay 'not great'.In{hard times}of no work they only had 6 weeks of{benefit money. After several years he became an {apprentice overlooker.}The mill owners asked him to stay on because he was a good worker. He{retired}at 69 shortly before the mill *closed. He was sad to leave the cotton industry and to see so many mills close. *see p13
